title: Lily Collins films scenes for Emily In Paris alongside Ashley Park
text:
She has spent the last several weeks in the city of love filming her upcoming TV series.

And Lily Collins was stylish as ever as she shot scenes for Emily In Paris alongside her co-star Ashley Park in the French capital on Monday.

The actress, 30, looked nothing short of sensational as she got into character, donning a navy plaid skirt along with a white top which she wore under an eye-catching red and white houndstooth coat.

Fun: Lily Collins, 30, was stylish as ever as she shot scenes for Emily In Paris alongside her co-star Ashley Park in the French capital on Monday

The Les Misérables star added height to her frame with a pair of trendy, thigh-high black leather boots while she also wrapped up in a khaki coat.

Styling her brunette locks into elegant waves, Lily wore a red hat and completed her look with a brown and beige handbag.

Lily looked in high spirits for the day of filming as she laughed with her co-star Ashley between takes while they strolled through a park.

Emily in Paris tells the story of an American woman in her 20s who moves from the Midwest to the city of love for an unexpected job opportunity.

Style: The actress looked nothing short of sensational as she got into character wearing an eye-catching red and white houndstooth coat

Work: Sporting a large khaki jacket, Lily filmed some scenes for the series while sitting on a park bench

Outfit: Lily also wore a white top and a plaid navy skirt while she added height to her frame with thigh-high leather boots

Leading character Emily must adjust to the challenges of life in a foreign city while balancing her new career, friendships and finding love.

The ten-part series, which is scheduled to air on Paramount Network in 2020, will see actor William Abadie and actresses Philippine Leroy-Beaulieu join Lily and Ashley for the comedy-drama.

Lily's appearance comes after she revealed that she would never take on a character who was solely there to be 'eye candy' in a movie or television show.

Speaking to Vulture earlier this year, the actress said: 'It’s not appealing to me to play someone who is just there for, whether it’s eye candy or the female perspective, you need more than that.

'It shouldn’t matter about the gender. It should matter about their drive.'

Lily first hit the screen at the age of two in the BBC drama Growing Pains before going on to star in Mirror Mirror in 2012 and To The Bone in 2017.

Her recent roles have also seen her play Fantine in the BBC's Les Misérables and Liz Kendall, the girlfriend to serial killer Ted Bundy, in the chilling Extremely Wicked, Shockingly Evil and Vile.

Speaking about playing the darker characters, she told The Guardian: 'I really enjoy playing these characters that, under the surface, have so much more going on than they are saying, or who seem like they are barely keeping it together.

'I've always believed that asking for help is not a weakness, it's a strength.'

'I have a tattoo that says: ''True delicacy is not a fragile thing.'' You can look delicate, but it doesn't mean that you're fragile.'
